## Neuronal signalling substances are released by vesicle fusion

::: columns
::: {.column width="60%"}
![](images/synapcse_ch9f1.jpg)

[Basic Neurochemistry: Molecular, Cellular and Medical Aspects](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK27964/)
:::
::: {.column width="30%"}
- vesicle fusion at the synapse
- small-transmitter release (Glu, GABA, ACh, Gly)
- synaptic or extrasynaptic release of neuropeptides
- synaptic or extrasynaptic release of monoamines (serotonin, noradrenaline etc.)
:::
:::

## Goals of the practical

<br><br>

- learn basic techniques with RNA and DNA (sequence analysis, isolation, PCR, cloning, sequencing)
- generate transgenic reporter constructs for _Platynereis_
- clone regulatory regions from genomic DNA for genes interest
- focus on monoamine biosynthesis enzyme-encoding genes
